website_summaries.verdict: With impressive power and an 8.6 feet telescopic pole, this model is a good option for users with slightly larger jobs than most households.
pros: The 8 amp motor offers cutting power that can handle soft limbs over 7 inches thick
The pole's 8.6 feet compares favorably with other models, and the 8-inch chain length meets the needs of most household users
The occasional large job won't wear out this machine as quickly as some other models, making it a good buy for households with more or larger trees than the average user
It converts from a pole saw to a chainsaw
cons: Some users report pressing the release trigger accidentally (due to its placement) can result in the head detaching from the pole when in use

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it does'nt unlock while in use.!
customer_reviews.text: For a 8 inch saw it cuts pretty good. I knocked out my trimming in no time. There is one complaint though, the release button is located right where my thumb goes and I found out the hard way it will unlock and release in no time. It gets a little scary to see the saw and extension heading to the ground and the control end in my hand. Luckily it fell on the grass so no damages. I ended up putting several wraps of black tape around the release button to keep it from unlocking while using.
customer_reviews.author: Ol' School

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Electric SUN JOE - 8 Amp Pole ChainSaw for Hard to Reach Tree Limbs
customer_reviews.text: After using this SUN JOE SWJ806E, I like everything about this Pole saw; Light, sturdy, pole extends very easily, very sharp 8" chain (7.5" cut) that goes through limbs like a hot knife slicing butter, great automatic chain oiler w/oil reservoir... Detaches from pole to use like conventional chainsaw, strong 8 amp motor (don't know why the item header says 7.5 amp?) it is an 8 amp motor, chain tension adjustment screw, electric (good for the environment) ... If you a looking for a electric extendable pole chain saw, consider this one as I highly recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Ray W

customer_reviews.title: Mighty little saw!
customer_reviews.text: This electric chainsaw is low cost and light weight but it is mighty! The day I got it, I used it to trim trees in a friends back yard and the next day took it to church to trim trees around the grounds with a bunch of other guys. It easily cuts off limbs that are about 4 to 5 inches in diameter as the blades are really sharp. The ability to convert between a pole saw and chainsaw is nice. Converting between the two configurations only takes about 10 seconds and doesn't require any tools...just a push of a button. Great saw for the money!
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim an Oak tree that was hanging over my work shop and for the money this saw works great. In the photos the tree had covered about 25% of the roof and needed to be trimmed. It took only minutes to trim the tree back and went through a 4 inch branch with ease. One of my best purchase as far as price vs effectiveness. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vibration

customer_reviews.title: Amazing chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is the best chainsaw ever it took me about 20 min to take this tree down. This is small bit packs a packs a punch. I couldn't be more Happy with my purchase I am so glad to have my new mighty saw.. thank you. It was very easy to use and came on time. I AM ONE HAPPY GIRL
customer_reviews.author: Ladyheart

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I love this small chainsaw! It is perfect for small(er) trees and limbs and also perfect for women. Trust me, if a middle age, out of shape, cancer survivor can use this saw anyone can. So glad I opted for the one that converts from handheld to pole saw. The pole saw takes a little practice and feels "top heavy" but once a few limbs come down you will want to just keep going. Converting it to handheld (or back to pole saw) takes about 10 seconds. Wish I had bought one of these years ago so I wouldn't have so much trimming and cutting to do now.
customer_reviews.author: luvahoula

customer_reviews.title: Snow Joe a company that refuses to help their customers!!
customer_reviews.text: The Electric Pole + Chain Saw that I bought with a 2 year + 90 day warranty broke about one year after purchase. I have attempted to contact Snow Joe via e-mail and phone more than 8 times and have never been able to speak with anyone. I have received 2 e-mail responses that just repeated what I had written. I need to replace 2 broken parts and I am willing to purchase them since they obviously won't honor their warranty. Jerry Spinner
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Trim those branches easier
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to do some trimming work in the yard on the taller trees and it fit the bill. It has worked beautifully both as a pole saw and converted to a hand held saw. Probably the only draw back I have is the oil reservoir can be a bit difficult to read at first and oil can spill out if you open it and the saw is not secured to something flat. Works best on branches with a diameter between 2"-6". Smaller branches tend to get gnarled up. You probably should use a different cutter for those. The pole is very sturdy and I am impressed by the quality of this saw for the price thus far.
customer_reviews.author: William Royce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use either extended (including fully extended) or as a conventional chainsaw, cuts fast and easy. Easy to setup and convert back and forth. It is plenty powerful to cut hardwood tree limbs with thick bark and large diameter. In hindsight maybe the 10" bar would be better for these larger limbs as the motor seems to have ample power.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Currently, very happy with my purchase. Cut through several fruit trees that hadn't been trimmed in years. It's been a month or so since I received my saw- the trees are doing great. The saw is operating perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron H

customer_reviews.title: Extension release beware
customer_reviews.text: Would I buy again? Yes Do you need to be extra careful? Yes 1) The release button for the extension bar is right next to the power button. Dangerous if you find yourself in an awkward spot. Very easy to disconnect the extender from the unit. Needs some sort of a latch vs button. 2) No instant blade stop like a traditional gas chain saw. Love the short saw to cut up branches but the extra couple seconds for the blade to stop is dangerous. Bottom line it is great price for a time saving tool but please take your time and avoid distractions.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy O

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself 2x over the 1st time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw. Never bogged down. A bit unwieldly when using the extension but solid operation. Cleaned all the dead out of my oak tree plus branches that were nearly touching the ground. Will wait a week + for the debris to dry out and I'll cut it all up into smaller pieces and just burn it. REALLY impressed with this little saw. It is exactly what I was looking for. Well worth getting if you have the need to clean up your property. Went through 4"+ diameter branches easily. The debris pile in the photos is of all the lower dead and ground touching branches. The Sun Joe made quick work of this task.
customer_reviews.author: M. Connelly

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cut all the dead stuff off our maple tree (about 1/3 of the tree). It was perfect for the job and chopping up the branches to put in our truck to haul away. Only minor complaint I had is that I had to run to get some chainsaw oil this morning before we used it as it didn’t come with any. You won’t be disappointed buying this.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, small flaw
customer_reviews.text: Cuts thru branches like butter. Motor does not hesitate. Seems well built and looks like is going to last. My only issue with it is the handle release button. I have release the handle a coupl of times by accident. It should have a lock or something to prevent accidental release. Fix that and you get a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: along with some immature sweet gumball trees from our neighbor's jungle backyard
customer_reviews.text: We decided between the 10 inch and this unit and went with the 8-inch blade--both being around the same price range. When we received it, we took it on a run and cut down a ton of branches overhanging our house, along with some immature sweet gumball trees from our neighbor's jungle backyard. The unit is a bit heavy for us when fully extended, so it took the two of us some adjusting to handle it while one of us was on the ladder and one on the floor :) 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing extension chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to trim up my maple trees. It works fantastically. As long as you follow the instruction for set up. It cuts super clean, up to a branch of 6” wide. The extension to regular chainsaw was super easy. The attachments are also super easy. Trimmed up two trees with this thing, worked amazingly. Just don’t let the blade touch the ground. The blade cover is sturdy. It was weighted correctly, could feel pretty heavy but you use the weight for cutting. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Chainsaw keeps coming loose.
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw keeps coming off the the bar every 8 to 10 cuts of 1 inch and 2 inch wide branches. Can't put it back on immediately. Have to wait for it completely cool off and shrink in size. Takes an hour to cool off. Tried the long pole attachment only once. The vibration and recoil was pretty strong. It was impossible to use. Gave up trying. The saw works fine when it is not overheated, and only when the extension pole is not used.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with product and Sun Joe's customer service.
customer_reviews.text: When I first received it and started using it I was impressed. However the fourth time I used it would not operate and I could hear a loose part inside. It appeared to be an electrical connection issue as visually everything mechanical looked good. I contacted Sun Joe and they sent me a UPS label to ship it back and I received a new replacement out of the box in the meantime. The replacement saw has been performing great ever since and can cut through 10" diameter trunks no problem. When cutting green wood just remember to clean out the chain sprocket area periodically to I wish all companies backed their products like Sun Joe. Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: Low expectations but highly impressed
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't have very high expectations for an inexpensive electric chainsaw. I only had one small tree to cut down and cut up into pieces so I didn't want to spend a lot of money on something I wouldn't use often. I was actually quite impressed with how well it worked. My tree was about 8 inches in diameter at the thickest part and this chain saw cut right through it with very little issue. By the time I was done the chain had stretched a little bit so needed to be adjusted but that is to be expected. Also this chainsaw does not come with bar oil, you will need to purchase that separately. Overall though very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: NOT VERY GOOD GUALITY CONTROL AT FACTORY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY 2ND SAW. THE FIRST ONE QUIT OILING THE BLADE AFTER 2 CUTS OF 1-1/2 TO 2 INCH LIMBS. SENT BACK. THIS ONE SAT ON FLOOR SINCE RECEIVED AS i WAS SICK FOR ABOUT TWO MONTHS. PICKED IT UP THIS MORNING. OIL ALL OVER THE FLOOR UNDER IT. STILL HAD MOST OF THE TANK SO I WENT OUT TO MAKE 3 MORE CUTS. DID A GREAT JOB CUTTING, BUT THE BLADE WAS DRY AFTER THE THIRD CUT. RAN SAW INTERMITTENTLY FOR ABOUT 3 MINUTES. AND OIL FINALLY SHOWED UP ALL AROUND THE CUTTING BLADE. NOT WORTH THE BUCKS AND AM GOING DUMP THE OIL INTO A PAND AND SEND IT BACK AND ASK FOR A REFUND.
customer_reviews.author: BK Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Id rather give this 3.5 but 4 it is. 8 give this a 4 cause the pole isnt the length nor does it extend to the length as described it starts at about 52 inches and extends to about 78 inches. It is a good saw for the price but it doesnt come with bar oil which wasnt a big deal for me as i had some already. Its easy to assemble and use. Just wished that pole was the length as described.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I had a few branches around my house that needed to be trimmed. I didn't have the need for a full powered gas chainsaw as everything I wanted to trim was under 8 inches in diameter. I did purchase some Chain lube at a local hardware store. YOU WILL NEED CHAIN OIL!!! The extender is great and allowed me to reach where I couldn't normally. This little saw cut though my trees without any issues. I like the fact that I can just use the chainsaw when I don't need it attached to the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio Medina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, just buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it yesterday and it works better then expected. Has a lot of power. Cut some branches approx 5 inch diameter and cut through like butter. It does get a little tiresome since the weight is at the end but that's expected. I cut branches approx 12 feet above ground. The other best part is that it detaches from the extension pole to become a regular chainsaw. Would buy again if needed. Make sure you buy oil since it doesn't come with any and you need it for the first use and everytime after that. Uses a small amount of oil.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful small chain saw, great with extension pole.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power for such a lightweight chain saw. Very quiet compared to a gas chain saw. Much easier to use with no having to refuel the fuel tank. Cuts very fast and clean. Did I mention how lightweight this is? I was going to go for a battery operated one yet the weight and pricing made this a much better deal. I chose the 8" model although the 10" has the same power and weight as I wanted the tight quarters' ability. Used it a couple of time for an hour or more and so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Handy little implement!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to aid in trimming the several fruit trees in our yard. It works great! After reading the reviews, I make sure when it's in storage it's laying flat horizontally (I remove the extension handle) and I've had no problems with oil leakage. I've also had to run 3 100' extension cords to get to the trees to be trimmed and have noticed no lack in cutting power. It was just zip and it was done. Love this little bugger!!
customer_reviews.author: patient retiree

customer_reviews.title: Great budget saw.
customer_reviews.text: Had a bunch of limbs that needed to come down in my front yard. Tree service quoted me $150. Did it myself for half the price using this saw. I was disappointed that it didn't come with any Bar/Chain oil. Had to make an unplanned trip to Lowes before I could start working. Other than that I have zero complaints. Great little saw that made short work of what I needed cut. Cut through multiple 4-5 inch diameter limbs like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Mishael Baggott

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for a small electric saw
customer_reviews.text: Have to say that I didn’t have a whole lot of faith in this little saw when I ordered it, but it surprised me. It was able cut through some branches at least 6 inches in diameter with little to no trouble. Still needed a ladder to reach some of the branches we were trimming but it was safer to use this saw than trying to climb with a typical gas saw. The convertible functionality is nice too. Use as a normal saw to cut already downed branches into smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron K.

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw might be small but it’s powerful! We trimmed 6 overgrown trees within hours and it was so easy. When we get our trees professionally trimmed we pay $150 per tree!! I’m so glad we purchased this chain saw to trim them ourselves. My parents borrowed the chainsaw to trim some branches as well and plan on getting their own now. I definitely recommend that you purchase chainsaw oil (it doesn’t come with any) and safety glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Great little chainsaw. I was honestly surprised at how powerful it was and how sharp the chain is. It was easy to assemble and easy to use. I was cutting palm fronds - that are notoriously hard to cut with chainsaws - with ease. It cut through limbs and exposed roots that were greater than 8” diameter with no problem. Never bogged down or hesitated. The chain did come off the guide bar a couple of times but I think that was a combination of my not adjusting the tension properly and cutting at weird (acute) angles.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Pena

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pole saw and saw
customer_reviews.text: So I have owned stihl all my life and I really didn't want to spend alot of money on a tree trimmer from Stihl. So I decided to invest in this one which is a great buy by the way. A storm blew through and took down a pretty good sized tree and this little work horse did the job not an easy job either for an electric pole saw. The added benefit of it breaking down to a regular chainsaw is even better.
customer_reviews.author: Jw W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This device is lighter than I expected, easyvtobassesbke, easyirt to use than I expected, and it tore through tree limbs like it was butter. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Useless after a couple branches
customer_reviews.text: Utterly useless. I was able to trim a few branches on my apple tree before the chain dulled. I've replaced the chain twice, neither works. It currently takes up space in my garage and doesn't even cut a 1 inch branch with a brand new chain.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaD

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up the chain saw, and to switch to chain saw and extension pole operation., then back again. Comes with enough chain oil to get initial few jobs done before need to buy more oil. Easy to add oil and to see when the amount of oil is getting low. As someone who had not used a chain saw before, I felt comfortable with the safety features and easy operation of the saw both as just the saw, and when mounted on the extension pole. Easy to start and clean cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Island guy

customer_reviews.title: Right tool for trimming. Easy-to-use and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw it's easy and lite, I noticed that the plastic connections started to give when the temperature got above 100 deg. F, but this saw is tough and with the reach and 8 in. Blade is more than I needed to trim my trees. It also has no problem getting in the hard to reach places. My trimming usually took 3 to 4 hours but with the small saw it only took an hour and my wife said that was the best trimming ever. Using the Right tool makes the job easier and almost fun.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a champ. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday. Cut a fairly large oak branch off, then cut it up. Saw worked very well, very fast. I found it easy to use in both modes, on the pole and hand held chain saw. Exactly what I was looking for. I don't have a lot of arm strength for over my head work, the 8 pound saw was plenty. I can't imagine the 13 to 15 pounders. I am 69 years old.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, flexible design, a little difficult to use.  Kind of heavy and off balance
customer_reviews.text: If you’re like me and only use this occasionally, like once or twice a year it’s great but if you have to use it a lot or often I would advise to look at a different saw. It is very inexpensive and reasonably good quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, powerful saw that is fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a breeze to use and actually makes trimming trees fun. So far, I have used it on limbs up to 5 inches in diameter with no problem. It is lightweight, seems well-constructed and cuts extremely well. It does consume oil at a fairly rapid rate, so you need to keep an eye on the indicator window on the side of the tool. Contrary to what some reviewers have said, no oil was included with the product, so I had to go to the local big box store for that. Overall, very pleased with my purchase and I will never use a gas-powered chainsaw again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... what I expected I purchased at 800 model was awesome the chain on this did not last a week
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected I purchased at 800 model was awesome the chain on this did not last a week
customer_reviews.author: michael bam

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, compact and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Impressively powerful for the price and size. So far I've used it to remove big fronds from a giant, tall canary palm, and it ripped through them with no problem. This works great when reaching vertically, but it can be a little awkward when reaching horizontally - the motor at the end of the pole is pretty heavy and it's not easy to keep it steady. But this is mostly intended for vertical reaches and it worked great for me... so far. I've only used it twice.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Lenthall

customer_reviews.title: Works for our needs
customer_reviews.text: This pull saw works great & especially for the price. I love the fact that you can use the saw with or without the pole. We’ve been able to cut three smaller trees down with it & with some of the branches being 4-5 inches in diameter. It does take a little work with the thicker branches, but it does get the job done. On a side note- it does not come with oil. You will need to purchase that separately.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewreader

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with oil. Order some
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give an actual review on how it works, but the fact that they didn't include even a sample bottle of chain/pole oil, I can't use the thing. I really wish they mentioned this in the description, it could have saved me a lot of time. So after I get the oil, maybe I'll find time to write another review. As of now, this oversite has cost them 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Santa8T

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - used once - Extension broke
customer_reviews.text: Small tree limb hit the extension pole where it attached to the chainsaw and broke both the plastic and one of the wired connectors inside. Don't ask me how because I don't even understand it, as the part that broke was part that slid INSIDE the chainsaw, but the chainsaw was fine. In fact, the chainsaw works well for a small chainsaw, but now it is pretty useless for what I bought it for, which was to get the branches higher up. Gave it two stars just because the chainsaw works and was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the versatility of the chain saw. It is easy to change from pole to regular saw. The chain is hard to get tight enough to not fall off when you start it. We found we needed a funnel to put oil in it, because the first time we did it, oil got all over the place. When it is on the pole it is a little unwieldy, you really need good upper body strength to use it as a pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Yates

customer_reviews.title: All around good corded electric pole saw. Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This little saw worked GREAT! It had some quality heft to it and for under $90.00! I had two large crepe myrtle bushes to bring down and the part of the job I was dreading the most was dealing with my gas chainsaw. This one fit the ticket and both bushes bought down with zero problems. I even remarked to a friend that for the cost of this saw, as far as I was concerned, it paid for its self with this one job.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and use. I'm about 5'3" 110lbs and had no issues using this to trim the tree in our front yard. Price is great too, I compared at Home Depot and Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I had my Doubts but its pretty powerful and very sturdy. I'm used the my still chainsaw but the sunjoe has impressed me. its very sturdy to. was cutting a 7in branch off and it slipped out of my had after the cut and fell to the ground and the branch landed on it and didnt damage it at all. Fast switching from pole to just handheld. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I love the versatility of having a small handheld saw or a pole saw. It's very easy to change between the two. It made quick work of cutting down 3 smaller trees and breaking them down. It is very easy to use and doesn't kick back a lot. It seems very well made and the 2 year warranty is great, although I did opt to extend that to the maximum of 5 years for an additional $13 because the coverage on it is very thorough. I have a Sun Joe pressure washer and tiller as well and I love them too. Can't go wrong with this company!
customer_reviews.author: Marki Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, durable little saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw a while back, and have used it several times. So far so good... Granted, I'm not doing any real heavy duty sawing, but that is not what it was designed for. Have trimmed a bunch of overgrown limbs and made several piles of firewood with no real issues. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and cut everything easy. I was able to easily chop down tall branches and then cut them down into smaller pieces once on the ground. I've never used a chainsaw and this one wasn't too bad to setup. Follow the instructions exactly, get safety goggles, and go to town on your yard hehe.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gondor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle, cuts smoothly
customer_reviews.text: The fact that you can cut high branches and still manage properly the device, the balance shine cutting is easy to manage, and it cuts smoothly. When not using the extension, the operation of as well easier and smooth. The safety button to start the saw is a great benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Randall B.

customer_reviews.title: Quickly and easily converts from chainsaw to pole saw.
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this saw as it does a good job and very quickly switches from light weight chain saw to a pole saw when needed. Almost ordered the pole saw but glad I bought this convertible model as the pole is great when needed but just gets in the way and adds weight when you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Came with the box damaged, Couldn't cut through any size branch over 1/8"-1/4" thick, it says 3"-5" thick(no way), I was so looking forward to cutting the over hanging branches, neighbors got a laugh watching, even purchased extra blades and chain/bar oil that I had to send back. VERY, VERY, VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! Don't think it would of cut through the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Laurie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value - terrific saw!
customer_reviews.text: The Sun Joe was easy to put together - added the chain oil (not included) and we were off to do some trimming of the LARGE oak and linden trees in my yard. The saw performed perfectly - sharp, easy to handle and I love the ease of converting the saw from a pole saw to a small chain saw. Really saved me time and effort - didn't have to fire up the full-size Stihl. Truly a great addition to the tool stable.
customer_reviews.author: dlp1960

customer_reviews.title: Convenient chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Had a dead branch on a tree. I never used a chain saw before. It was easy and fun to use and I saved quite a lot of money doing it myself. I have several products from this company and have been very happy with their instructions and service as well as their garuntee policy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Karp

customer_reviews.title: Better quality then the pictures suggest!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to get a feel for the build quality of the Sun Joe pole saw from the pictures alone. Once it arrived and was assembled, its sturdy build was apparent. I'm not sure how it lives up to commercial or everyday use but for a bit of heavy seasonal use, it seems up to the task just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh A.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool very sturdy easy to install and works like it should. Con it is too short i had to use a latter to reach up and also after extending it it was crazy heavy. i got a smaller blade because i new it was going to have some weight. all in all i enjoy using it it makes the job easier
customer_reviews.author: Jam7

customer_reviews.title: Wow! At a loss for words!
customer_reviews.text: I still look at the tree and think... this cut through that! I cut down completely a whole tree. Cut through the limbs and cut through the whole trunk of the tree! With no problem at all. Make sure you go grab some bar oil before it gets delivered, so your ready to go to town!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with this product, I’ve used it several times and it has never given me any problems cuts well easy to handle. I removed a 30+ foot tree that was over my pool in and cut it in to firewood in no time at all. If you need a low priced limb/chain saw this is the one for you of I could give it more than 5 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: thomas e wadlington

customer_reviews.title: Best yard tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tool we’ve purchased for our property. It works great. It’s easy to use. Cuts through tree limbs like butter. Perfect amount of power, easy to handle. For the money this yard tool provides a ton of value if you need to clean up your yard of tree growth. It deserves six stars out of five.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Buy it !
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool .... buy it ! No issues this thing is strong and the chain has not slipped .... I even got wire tangled in this and it was easy to remove and I got right back to work .... I recently bought the San joe power washer too and that thing kicks but too!!
customer_reviews.author: Dar5r

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: First, I’m a female and was looking to save money to cut down a tree in our back. I started with a hand saw and pooped out. Ordered this fine machine and it was a gem. Easy to use, easy to assemble. When the saw is on the extender it does become a little weighted but doable. Highly recommend. Note: order the oil too cause you will need it!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Curt

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this because we needed limbs cut down and from the moment we opened the box we loved it!! It’s great quality and works great we’ve used it quite a few times and would defiantly recommend this to anyone looking to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Stops randomly
customer_reviews.text: For the saw it works fine when its working but it would stop by itself all of a sudden. So every time it stops I have to restart it and that takes forever
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Martin

customer_reviews.title: very practical for home use
customer_reviews.text: cutting a large limb is very easy with this pole saw, what takes more time is once the limb is down, I have to cut it to small pieces so they can be pick up by trash company, now this is the part this saw become very handy, I can just take out the pole and it become a regular electric chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: MKMR

customer_reviews.title: Good Light Duty Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little chainsaw that works well. Easy to change from pole to handle. Definitely a light duty chainsaw though. The changeable handle can come loose under too much pressure. And mine was a dark forest green instead of the lime in the picture. But for what it is, it's really good.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This is powerful little chainsaw. Chainsaw itself is very light but when you connect to extention, It gets heavier. But it does job done. I trimmed four big trees and I think I saved about 700 dollars. I really satisfy this product. I like to recommend to anyone...
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: If you have trees, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I used this pole mounted chain saw to trim a couple maple trees and it worked perfectly. Plenty of power and easy to use. Compared to the cost of a tree service, this thing is a bargain. Love that it detaches from the pole and can be used as a small chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Al Ricko

customer_reviews.title: worth its weight
customer_reviews.text: This saw is just what I needed. It was recommended to me from a friend. Very easy to connect the extention pole for the higher work then quickly disconnects for a handheld saw. It is a bit heavy when on the pole and extended but I managed. It has saved me easily its cost by not having to pay "Chuck in a truck" tree service companies that makes their rounds after a storm.
customer_reviews.author: Marc A. Doonan

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a chainsaw not to mention a pole ...
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars... Great price for a chainsaw not to mention a pole chainsaw. The change to use the pole or not is simple. So far it made fast easy work out breaking down a large tree branch. I'll be trying out the pole next week to do a major trim back of our tree. I'll up date again after that.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Very cool idea... 2 in one
customer_reviews.text: This saw worked like a charm both with the pole and without. Took my husband a while to put it together and it is a bit heavy for this 67 year old woman while using the pole, but I can't see how it could be made lighter. So he sawed the higher branches, and I used as a chainsaw for the limbs that were down.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Light
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Light enough to use even when extended. Quiet enough to not disturb the neighbors. Oil capacity is relatively small so you'll need to keep an eye of the oil level.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Hire a gardener, not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: You need some muscle to hold this on the wand. Arms got tired after 10 minutes. Added oil but still smelled motor burning
customer_reviews.author: A. Beverhausen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap chain. Design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Little too heavy to maneuver. The straight angle does not work. If the saw was attached at 45 degrees, it would work much better. Worst part -- the chain dulled out only after a little use. It doesnt cut anything anymore. Just spins and burns the wood.... the chain is useless.
customer_reviews.author: In H. Chung

customer_reviews.title: Chain jammed on sprocket first day using it.
customer_reviews.text: I started out liking this, doing a nice job clearing shrubs. Then the chain didn't just fall off the bar, it came off the sprocket and gouged into the plastic casing. Can't get it loose. Whole thing is totally useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Jane D.

customer_reviews.title: Its easy to use and feel safe using it
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6" and i still can't reach some branches with this extension. Its my first time using a chain saw. Its easy to use and feel safe using it. Its loud but it is a chain saw! Easy to switch between extension and hand held mode
customer_reviews.author: AW12345

customer_reviews.title: Best tool purchase of 2020
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is amazing! I took down a 30', 10" spruce tree with ease. Although timid at first, as I proceeded, it became apparent this "little" saw out performs many "big" saws. Gasoline chain saws and I do not mix well. Just push the button and then the trigger and you are off to "cutting" bliss. It "self" oils and will do just about any job with ease. The ability to switch from just the saw to a pole saw is remarkable! As a professional handyman I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: brillo

customer_reviews.title: Good little no-Fuss saw for around the house
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great around the house to saw branches at full extension and small trees at their base. I’ve used it to clear scrub at the edge of my property and cut up small diameter trees, up to about 5”. The only way I’ve stalled it is to get the bar pinched. Plenty of power for the bar length.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the box, read the directions, bought the correct oil. It started up fine. I cut through half a 2 inch branch and the entire chain assembly bent. The chain tightening screw bent on the very first time. I even bought the correct oil, not some cheap ass canola or 30W oil. I'm getting ready to return it immediately and buy something that works.
customer_reviews.author: George T Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Comes separated constantly.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for about 15 minutes today. It cut great when it stayed together. It came apart about 10 times at both connections. The plastic snap connectors don’t do a good job keeping it together.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Vensko

customer_reviews.title: Handle Broke in the first 20 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke the first 20 minutes of us using it. Very disappointed. We needed it for a weekend project and barely got started.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best 65 Bux  i ever spent on yard tools
customer_reviews.text: Totally Amazing!!!! This thing cuts so easily and is lightweight. I trimmed and cut down a 10 in diameter tree in 20 min. When you get it just add bar chain oil like it says, adjust the chain like it tells you and connect the extension then you done , tuh dahhhh ! Start cutting!
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The oil fill is too small cap cannot tighten if you do it backs up one thread and is real loose and when you hang it in the garage drips oil from the chain area
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J

customer_reviews.title: Great for Your trimming needs
customer_reviews.text: Had a bunch of trees that needed some serious trimming. Needed to have a way to reach and trim with the action of a chainsaw. The Sun Joe worked great and was fairly easy to maneuver and reach challenging places on the trees.
customer_reviews.author: Bdogg

customer_reviews.title: Good Value overall
customer_reviews.text: Good Value overall but wish it was a little lighter. It can tire you put pretty quick in extension mode...howvwr, it cuts very well and can transform quickly. Happy with price and quick delivery
customer_reviews.author: J. J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and easy to use and maintain. Used to cut 8 inch thick tree no problem. Pole can get heavy after awhile so be careful. Comes with a chain cover and all the tools you need.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Both the chain saw and the extension pole look and feel great. High quality product. Although the chainsaw is only 8inch it is not as small as I thought it would be, it is up to just about any task as stand alone or on the pole.
customer_reviews.author: TechSystems USA

customer_reviews.title: Great versatitity
customer_reviews.text: Easy to convert from pole saw to hand saw when needed. It has plenty of power for smaller branches and smaller trees/saplings. It is difficult to hold (especially when fully extended) for prolonged time periods.
customer_reviews.author: David Deck

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I was taking a risk on this one - wondering if I was just wasting money on a cheaply made product. I’ve been pleasantly surprised :) which makes me happy. This sunjoe works well and is easy to use, lightweight and exceeds my expectation. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this mainly because I’ve never heard of this company and the price seemed low to me. I was definitely wrong. I love this thing and use it all the time. Definitely would recommend 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to trim branches and it worked great! Then we had a large tree fall on our property and we used this for everything but the trunk. Then we had another large tree fall last week and we used this to cut a wedge in the trunk and to cut all the limbs off. It works WAY better than our other 18 inch 15 amp chainsaw and we are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: After sitting in storage for about a month all of the chain oil somehow leaks out all over my garage and nothing was loose. Other than that it's a good little branch trimmer
customer_reviews.author: DysfunctionalVeteran85

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This does work very well. Great for limbs . The weight alone does it all . Would have been nice if a little longer like the hand pole saw but still very nice. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Biker

customer_reviews.title: Yesss!
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah baby! We used this to cut thick branches of our large backyard tree. It is light weight so was no problem to maneuver it from up a 24' ladder. I just wish I would have gotten one with a slightly longer blade.
customer_reviews.author: Radius

customer_reviews.title: Sun joe
customer_reviews.text: This Chain Saw is amazing .I used it this morning to cut some large branches off a huge mesquite tree I have growing next my house it went and did the job.I made a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for light duty branch removal around the yard. Easy to assemble on the pile for long range trimming and take apart to use as just a chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is awesome! Very easy to switch from pole saw to just regular chainsaw. Grip is really good and it’s pretty lightweight. Just needs to come with a bottle of bar and chain oil. Awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Corrina

customer_reviews.title: The outside package was fine but the original package from supplier was trashed
customer_reviews.text: This product was broken when I got it. The outside package was fine but the original package from supplier was trashed. There is no way they could not have seen that it was damaged. Whoever the supplier is is very crooked and should not be purchased from.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl J. Mercer

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: The pole extends to reach way up in the trees for those low hanging branches. A very useful tool. And customer service is the best. It really helps me get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kegs

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to understand the instructions on putting on the chain. It also does not include oil. Overall easy to use but a bit on the heavy side when extended to reach a branch
customer_reviews.author: Victor M.

customer_reviews.title: In about ten minutes you are up and running!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this perfect little saw-so lightweight easy to maneuver from saw to chainsaw in seconds. It cuts through small limbs that are high and with little to no effort at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Flewell

product_meta.title: Sun Joe SWJ806E 8-Inch 8.0 Amp 2-in-1 Convertible Pole Chain Saw, Green
product_meta.description: Color:GreenSAW WHAT YOU SEE – WITH THE ONE SAW THAT DOES DOUBLE DUTY! Tackle those hard-to-reach branches with ease. The Sun Joe SWJ806E 2-in-1 convertible electric pole chain + saw takes the danger and difficulty out of trimming your overgrown trees. Stand safely on solid ground and simply adjust Sun Joe’s telescoping pole to gain up to 15 feet of overhead reach. Later, when the limbs are down and there’s wood to be cut, Sun Joe quickly converts to a hand-held chainsaw to make light work of loads of logs. Powered by a robust 7.5-amp motor, the SWJ806E can handle the most stubborn tree limbs up to 7.5-inches thick. It features a durable, 8-inch Oregon bar and chain with an auto-oiler to keep the bar and chain fully lubricated during use. Unlike gas-powered tools, Sun Joe is powered electrically, so you’ll power up reliably every time with the push of a button, without having to deal with smoke, fumes, spark plugs or costly tune-ups. Plus the SWJ806E comes equipped with a built-in safety switch to prevent accidental starting. The Sun Joe SWJ806E convertible electric pole chain + saw carries a full two-year warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars952 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
